statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Carlton's double-double helps Howard beat Coppin State 77-60
article.headline: Carlton's double-double helps Howard beat Coppin State 77-60
article.linkText: Carlton's double-double helps Howard beat Coppin State 77-60
article.story: BALTIMORE -- James Carlton scored 27 points and pulled down 13 rebounds to lead Howard to a 77-60 victory over Coppin State on Saturday. James Daniel III made 4 of 5 3-point attempts to add 18 points and James Miller scored 10 for the Bison (13-12, 7-4), who are in third place in the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference. Carlton has seven double-doubles this season. Taariq Cephas made 4 of 6 tries from the arc in scoring 18 points with Sterling Smith making 5 of 10 from 3-point range en route to 17 points for the Eagles (5-20, 4-8). Cephas became the 22nd player in school history to reach 1,000 career points. Howard led 38-31 at halftime and by as many as 20 late. The Bison made 25 of 46 shots for 54.3 percent, 22 of 29 from the free-throw line and had a 40-20 rebounding advantage. The Eagles shot 37 percent.
